title: Supersize string literals cause complaints on osx

content.raw:
Building `UNIT_gzlog_TEST` causes some complaints by the osx compiler about the length of some string literals in [pr2_state_log_expected.h](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/420e6ed9ed903894494383ec35c9f1007fed24e2/test/data/pr2_state_log_expected.h?at=default). It gives a `-Woverlength-strings` warning and claims that C++ compilers are only required to support string literals of up to 65536 characters. Each of the strings it complains about are over 100,000 characters.
~~~

/Users/scpeters/osrf/gazebo/test/data/pr2_state_log_expected.h:35:1: warning: string literal of length 132377
      exceeds maximum length 65536 that C++ compilers are required to support [-Woverlength-strings]

/Users/scpeters/osrf/gazebo/test/data/pr2_state_log_expected.h:38:1: warning: string literal of length 116149
      exceeds maximum length 65536 that C++ compilers are required to support [-Woverlength-strings]

/Users/scpeters/osrf/gazebo/test/data/pr2_state_log_expected.h:41:1: warning: string literal of length 116032
      exceeds maximum length 65536 that C++ compilers are required to support [-Woverlength-strings]

/Users/scpeters/osrf/gazebo/test/data/pr2_state_log_expected.h:44:1: warning: string literal of length 116050
      exceeds maximum length 65536 that C++ compilers are required to support [-Woverlength-strings]

/Users/scpeters/osrf/gazebo/test/data/pr2_state_log_expected.h:47:1: warning: string literal of length 116238
      exceeds maximum length 65536 that C++ compilers are required to support [-Woverlength-strings]

/Users/scpeters/osrf/gazebo/test/data/pr2_state_log_expected.h:50:1: warning: string literal of length 116012
      exceeds maximum length 65536 that C++ compilers are required to support [-Woverlength-strings]
~~~
content.html:
Building UNIT_gzlog_TEST causes some complaints by the osx compiler about the length of some string literals in pr2_state_log_expected.h. It gives a -Woverlength-strings warning and claims that C++ compilers are only required to support string literals of up to 65536 characters. Each of the strings it complains about are over 100,000 characters.

/Users/scpeters/osrf/gazebo/test/data/pr2_state_log_expected.h:35:1: warning: string literal of length 132377
      exceeds maximum length 65536 that C++ compilers are required to support [-Woverlength-strings]

/Users/scpeters/osrf/gazebo/test/data/pr2_state_log_expected.h:38:1: warning: string literal of length 116149
      exceeds maximum length 65536 that C++ compilers are required to support [-Woverlength-strings]

/Users/scpeters/osrf/gazebo/test/data/pr2_state_log_expected.h:41:1: warning: string literal of length 116032
      exceeds maximum length 65536 that C++ compilers are required to support [-Woverlength-strings]

/Users/scpeters/osrf/gazebo/test/data/pr2_state_log_expected.h:44:1: warning: string literal of length 116050
      exceeds maximum length 65536 that C++ compilers are required to support [-Woverlength-strings]

/Users/scpeters/osrf/gazebo/test/data/pr2_state_log_expected.h:47:1: warning: string literal of length 116238
      exceeds maximum length 65536 that C++ compilers are required to support [-Woverlength-strings]

/Users/scpeters/osrf/gazebo/test/data/pr2_state_log_expected.h:50:1: warning: string literal of length 116012
      exceeds maximum length 65536 that C++ compilers are required to support [-Woverlength-strings]
